description: Technical Product Owner - Cloud and Infrastructure He angitūtanga: The OpportunityAuckland Council is on the lookout for a dynamic and innovative Technical Product Owner with deep expertise in cloud and infrastructure services. If you're a hands-on leader with a proven track record in modern cloud platforms, automation, containerization, and DevOps, this is your chance to shape the future of technology at Auckland Council. You'll drive the design of secure, resilient, and scalable infrastructure, all while leading diverse teams, influencing stakeholders, and championing the adoption of emerging technologies.This is more than just a role - it's a chance to lead a transformation, advancing our cloud strategy and helping us evolve towards a product-based delivery model underpinned by cutting-edge cloud solutions. Your work will directly contribute to building smarter, more resilient technology systems that benefit the communities of Tāmaki Makaurau. He kōrero mōu: About YouYou are an innovative, forward-thinking leader ready to take the reins in driving cloud and infrastructure solutions for a large, complex organization. As a Technical Product Owner, you'll be instrumental in setting the direction of Auckland Council's cloud infrastructure, guiding teams to deliver high-impact solutions that scale, and ensuring that we stay at the forefront of technology trends.You have a passion for cloud innovation, a deep understanding of security and identity management, and expertise in DevOps practices. You excel in collaborating with cross-functional teams, building strong vendor relationships, and driving the adoption of new technologies that continuously improve our infrastructure. You're a natural leader with a focus on creating high-performing teams and fostering a culture of agility, resilience, and continuous improvement.Key Responsibilities Shape & Prioritize the Cloud Roadmap: Collaborate closely with the Architecture Team to develop and prioritize a cloud and infrastructure strategy that aligns with Auckland Council's long-term goals and evolving business needs. Oversee Hybrid Infrastructure & Security: Lead the management of both physical and cloud infrastructure, ensuring robust security, seamless integration, and compliance with industry standards for identity management. Drive DevOps Adoption & Efficiency: Champion DevOps practices across teams, promoting automation, continuous integration, and operational efficiency to accelerate delivery and improve performance. Collaborate with Vendors: Work alongside cloud providers and technology vendors to design scalable, resilient cloud solutions, ensuring that they meet business requirements and service-level agreements (SLAs). Ensure Reliability & Resilience: Oversee the implementation of infrastructure solutions that are reliable, resilient, and optimized for performance, cost-efficiency, and scalability, ensuring long-term alignment with the organization's needs. Qualifications A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, IT, or a related field, or equivalent practical experience. 10+ years' experience in network services or infrastructure, with proven expertise in product management, cross-functional team leadership, and driving cloud transformation. Solid understanding of Agile methodologies and product development best practices. Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to influence stakeholders across all levels of the organization. Proven track record of successfully leading teams, driving initiatives, and solving complex, technical challenges. Benefits Professional Growth: Access to ongoing learning and development opportunities to progress in your career. Collaborative & Inclusive Environment: A supportive, dynamic team culture that values diversity, creativity, and teamwork. Flexible Work Options: Enjoy a healthy work-life balance with flexible working arrangements to suit your lifestyle. If you're a visionary Technical Product Owner eager to make a lasting impact on cloud and infrastructure services, we want to hear from you. Join Auckland Council's Technology Services team and help shape the digital future of Auckland, delivering innovative solutions that benefit our diverse communities.
